summary_strategy: Reframe summary around operational reliability and ambiguity resolution—emphasize production ownership, deployable controls, and measurable risk reduction aligned with wraithwatch’s security-first pragmatism
skills_strategy: Use condensed 3-line format to prioritize high-priority skills (Security Engineering & Automation, Cloud/Platform Integrations, Security Data/AI) while preserving technical specificity and removing redundancy; group tools under functional categories without listing every tool

experience_focus.must_highlight: deployable controls with measurable outcomes, API-driven automation (CrowdStrike RTR, Microsoft Graph), asset reconciliation at scale
experience_focus.safe_metrics_to_keep: 10,000+ devices, 25 percent compliance improvement, 200 hours saved annually, 30 percent reduction in user-reported issues
experience_focus.claims_to_avoid: invented metrics like '25 percent improvement' without explicit source attribution, speculative ownership claims (e.g., 'led cross-departmental initiative' unless explicitly stated), or vague terms like 'enterprise-grade' without context

risk_controls: Never invent metrics—keep only numbers explicitly present in source resume
Replace phrases like 'pioneered' or 'established the technical standard' with factual descriptions (e.g., 'built auditable RAG pipeline for internal SecOps knowledge retrieval')
Avoid corporate buzzwords: 'synergy', 'holistic', 'end-to-end'—use concrete verbs like 'built', 'integrated', 'automated'
Do not add projects, tools, or responsibilities absent from baseline resume
